content: 1 Paul､ prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy my brother,— Unto Philemon the beloved､ and a fellow-worker of ours,
content_old: 1 Paul､ prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy my brother,— Unto Philemon the beloved､ and a fellow-worker of ours,

content: 2 And unto Apphia our sister. And unto Archippus our fellow-soldier, And unto the assembly which meeteth at thy house:
content_old: 2 And unto Apphia our sister. And unto Archippus our fellow-soldier, And unto the assembly which meeteth at thy house:

content: 3 Favour unto you､ and peace､ From God our Father､ and Lord Jesus Christ.
content_old: 3 Favour unto you､ and peace､ From God our Father､ and Lord Jesus Christ.

content: 4 I am giving thanks unto my God— Always making mention of thee in my prayers,
content_old: 4 I am giving thanks unto my God— Always making mention of thee in my prayers,

content: 5 Hearing of thy love､ and of the faith which thou hast towards the Lord Jesus and towards all the saints,—
content_old: 5 Hearing of thy love､ and of the faith which thou hast towards the Lord Jesus and towards all the saints,—

content: 6 To the end that the fellowship of thy faith may become energetic by a personal knowledge of every good thing that is in us towards Christ;
content_old: 6 To the end that the fellowship of thy faith may become energetic by a personal knowledge of every good thing that is in us towards Christ;

content: 7 For much joy have | had､ and encouragement､ by occasion of thy love, In that the tender affections of the saints have had rest given them by thee､ brother.
content_old: 7 For much joy have | had､ and encouragement､ by occasion of thy love, In that the tender affections of the saints have had rest given them by thee､ brother.

content: 8 Wherefore though I have much freedom of speech in Christ､ to be enjoining upon thee that which is befitting
content_old: 8 Wherefore though I have much freedom of speech in Christ､ to be enjoining upon thee that which is befitting

content: 9 Yet for love’s sake I rather exhort,— Being such a one as Paul the aged, Now also､ even a prisoner of Christ Jesus,—
content_old: 9 Yet for love’s sake I rather exhort,— Being such a one as Paul the aged, Now also､ even a prisoner of Christ Jesus,—

content: 10 I exhort thee concerning my own child､ Whom I have begotten in my bonds,—Onesimus:
content_old: 10 I exhort thee concerning my own child､ Whom I have begotten in my bonds,—Onesimus:

content: 11 Him who at one time was unto thee unserviceable, But now unto thee and unto me serviceable;
content_old: 11 Him who at one time was unto thee unserviceable, But now unto thee and unto me serviceable;

content: 12 Whom I have sent back unto thee—Him, That is my own tender affections!—
content_old: 12 Whom I have sent back unto thee—Him, That is my own tender affections!—

content: 13 Whom I was minded with myself to detain, That in thy behalf unto me he might be ministering in the bonds of the joyful message;
content_old: 13 Whom I was minded with myself to detain, That in thy behalf unto me he might be ministering in the bonds of the joyful message;

content: 14 But apart from thy mind I wished to do nothing, That not as by necessity thy goodness should be､ but by choice.
content_old: 14 But apart from thy mind I wished to do nothing, That not as by necessity thy goodness should be､ but by choice.

content: 15 For peradventure for this cause was he separated for an hour That as an age-abiding possession thou mightest have him back,—
content_old: 15 For peradventure for this cause was he separated for an hour That as an age-abiding possession thou mightest have him back,—

content: 16 No longer as a servant､ But above a servant—A brother beloved,— Very greatly to me, But how much rather to thee— Both in the flesh and in the Lord!
content_old: 16 No longer as a servant､ But above a servant—A brother beloved,— Very greatly to me, But how much rather to thee— Both in the flesh and in the Lord!

content: 17 If､ therefore､ thou holdest me as one in thy fellowship Take him unto thee as myself;
content_old: 17 If､ therefore､ thou holdest me as one in thy fellowship Take him unto thee as myself;

content: 18 And if he hath wronged thee at all or oweth thee aught The same､ unto me do thou reckon:—
content_old: 18 And if he hath wronged thee at all or oweth thee aught The same､ unto me do thou reckon:—

content: 19 I､ Paul have written it with my own hand,— I will repay it; That I may not tell thee—That thy-self､ unto me thou still owest.
content_old: 19 I､ Paul have written it with my own hand,— I will repay it; That I may not tell thee—That thy-self､ unto me thou still owest.

content: 20 Yea! brother I would from thee have help､ in the Lord: Give rest unto my tender affections in Christ.
content_old: 20 Yea! brother I would from thee have help､ in the Lord: Give rest unto my tender affections in Christ.

content: 21 Confident of thine obedience I have written unto thee, Knowing that even beyond what I say thou wilt do:—
content_old: 21 Confident of thine obedience I have written unto thee, Knowing that even beyond what I say thou wilt do:—

content: 22 At the same time moreover､ be also getting ready for me a lodging; For I am hoping that through your prayers I shall be granted as a favour unto you.
content_old: 22 At the same time moreover､ be also getting ready for me a lodging; For I am hoping that through your prayers I shall be granted as a favour unto you.

content: 23 There salute thee—Epaphras my fellow-captive in Christ Jesus,
content_old: 23 There salute thee—Epaphras my fellow-captive in Christ Jesus,

content: 24 Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, Luke,—my fellow-workers.
content_old: 24 Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, Luke,—my fellow-workers.
